public_fork_note:
We found DMSO can affect the fluorescence of DNA, which caused underestimation. We recommend centrifuging down DMSO before transferring Sybr green II into the working solution.
The assay is now revised for processing 24 samples per day instead of previous 10 samples.

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"5uvug","text":" No data is available addressing the mutagenicity or toxicity of  SYBR®  Green II Nucleic Acid Gel Stain. Because this reagent  binds to nucleic acids, it should be treated as a potential  mutagen and used with appropriate care. The DMSO stock  solution should be handled with particular caution as DMSO is  known to facilitate the entry of organic molecules into tissues.  We strongly recommend using double gloves when handling  the DMSO stock solution. As with all nucleic acid stains,  solutions of SYBR Green II Nucleic Acid Gel Stain should be  poured through activated charcoal before disposal or collected in waste container to be treated later. The  charcoal must then be incinerated to destroy the dye. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
